title: Meet the superstar realtors using reality TV to sell billions in property
text:
In the sparkly sphere of super-prime property in Los Angeles, there are “celebrities on every corner,” says realtor Tracy Tutor (pictured above) from Douglas Elliman Beverly Hills.

But many of the west coast metropolis’s estate agents come with A-list status of their own, nurturing lucrative careers as media personalities and motivational gurus along with selling some of the world’s most glamorous bricks and mortar.

The reality TV show Million Dollar Listing – whose original LA-based series in 2006 has spawned imitators in Miami, New York and San Francisco - has made household names and multi-millionaires of the likes of Madison Hildebrand (net worth $25m) and Josh Altman ($10m).

“At the beginning,...
